Excellent lunch spot if you are in the Gaudi houses area.  The pepitas are "sandwiches" that are absolutely delicious.  I had the beef, four and egg one that was yummy.  My wife really loved her tuna papita.  If you have not tried it, try the mato for dessert.  It's a smooth goat cheese drenched in honey, only served in Catalan apparently.  The waitress was very welcoming and friendly, and she was happy to give us recommendations in english when asked.  We also asked her if the place was popular, and she told us that because they are so highly rated on Trip Advisor, and near the tourist attractions, that their restaurant has really taken off.  Deservedly so!
